question: Which cricket ground is known as the "Cradle of Cricket"?
explanation: Broadhalfpenny Down cricket ground is known as the "Cradle of Cricket". Broadhalfpenny Down is a historic cricket ground in Hambledon, Hampshire, located in England. It is known as the "Cradle of Cricket" because it was the home venue in the 18th century of the Hambledon Club, but cricket predated the club and ground by at least two centuries.
